description: Construction of two storey dwellinghouse with habitable roof space (following demolition of existing garages).
decision_conditions: The proposal by reason of its design, siting, scale, appearance, orientation and access would represent an inappropriate, ad-hoc, cramped and incongruous form of development that is out of keeping with the prevailing pattern of development within the area to the detriment of surrounding amenity and character and that would set a harmful precedent for future development. As such, it is contrary to policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016), policy D4 of the Draft London Plan (2019; intend to publish) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | The proposal by way of insufficient private amenity space, poor outlook and light provision and single aspect levels would provide cramped, substandard accommodation for future occupiers to the detriment of their residential amenity. As such, it is contrary to policies 3.5, 7B and 7D of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | The proposal by reason of its close proximity to two well-established trees protected by a Tree Preservation Order, most likely requiring their removal with no mitigation proposed, would result in harm to the amenity and character of the area. As such, it is contrary to policy 5.10 Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 7.21 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
